description.value:
Druids of the Verdant Circle are floral guardians of plant life, finding purpose in the beauty of vegetation. They see purity and wonder in primal forest, and strength in the ancient trees of the wilds. A verdant druid might go for months in the deep jungles without seeing another soul, pursuing their goal of protecting nature from the ravages of unnatural threats. Druids of this circle often find the line blurred between plants and animals, and take on aspects of the flora they protect when defending their ‘friends’. Fighting such a warrior in the wilds is to have the very land turn against you, as plants rise up to support them in a wave of branches and tangled briars.

In Eberron, the largest group of such druids are the Verdant Path in Xen’drik, who learn from and protect the land spirit Kwinharin. Their home in the Rainwoods is draped with ancient moss and vines that hang between gargantuan trees. Others can be found in the Na’qalla drow, and the Rushemé druids. In Khorvaire, Verdant druids can be found in the Eldeen reaches, especially among the devout followers of the Greatpine Oalian. The strangest are those who deal with aberrant and planar flora - the cultists of the daelkyr Avassh, and the bizarre gardeners of the Grim Lord Varonaen on the umbral island of Farlnen
